sen.j: 西園寺 寛季（さいおんじ ひろすえ、天明6年12月5日 (旧暦)（1787年1月23日） - 安政3年2月12日 (旧暦)（1856年3月18日））は、江戸時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Hirosue SAIONJI (January 23, 1787 – March 18, 1856) was a Court noble in the late Edo period.
Hirosue SAIONJI (January 23, 1787 – March 18, 1856) was Kugo (a Court Noble) in the late Edo period.
sen.cmt: Kugyoを追加し、court nobleを大文字にしました。
sen.e: Hirosue SAIONJI (January 23, 1787 – March 18, 1856) was Kugo (a Court Noble) in the late Edo period.

sen.j: 主に光格天皇（119代）・仁孝天皇（120代）の二帝に仕えた。
sen.e: He mainly served for two emperors: Emperor Kokaku (the 119th) and Emperor Ninko (the 120th).
He primarily served for the two sovereigns: the 119th Emperor Kokaku and the 120th Emperor Ninko.
sen.cmt: two emperors→the two emperorsを訂正しました。天皇の何代の位置を移動しました。
sen.e: He primarily served for the two sovereigns: the 119th Emperor Kokaku and the 120th Emperor Ninko.

sen.j: 最終官位は正二位中納言。
sen.e: His last official rank was Shonii-chunagon (vice-councilor of state at the Senior Second Rank).
He was promoted up to Shonii-Chunagon (Senior Second Rank and Vice-Councilor of State).
sen.cmt: He was promoted up toに訂正しました。役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。他の西園寺ファイルとの表現を統一するため、ランクと役職の表記方法を訂正しました。
sen.e: He was promoted up to Shonii-Chunagon (Senior Second Rank and Vice-Councilor of State).

sen.j: 実父は左大臣二条治孝。
sen.e: His natural father was Sadaijin (minister of the left), Harutaka NIJO.
His real father was Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Harutaka NIJO.
sen.cmt: natural→realに訂正しました。役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: His real father was Sadaijin (Minister of the Left) Harutaka NIJO.

sen.j: 母は参議徳川宗翰（水戸藩）の娘。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Sangi (councilor), Munemoto TOKUGAWA (the Mito Domain).
His mother was a daughter of Sangi (Councilor) Munemoto TOKUGAWA of the Mito Domain.
sen.cmt: 役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。(the Mito Domain)→of the Mito Domainに訂正しました。
sen.e: His mother was a daughter of Sangi (Councilor) Munemoto TOKUGAWA of the Mito Domain.

sen.j: 養父は左大臣西園寺賞季。
sen.e: His foster father was Sadaijin, Yoshisue SAIONJI.
His adoptive father was Sadaijin Yoshisue SAIONJI.
His adoptive father was Sadaijin Yoshisue SAIONJI.

sen.j: 室に大谷光暉の娘、継室に大納言正親町公明の娘。
sen.e: His wife was a daughter of Mitsuteru OTANI, and his second wife was a daughter of Dainagon (chief councilor of state), Kinaki OGIMACHI.
His legitimate wife was a daughter of Mitsuteru OTANI; His second wife was a daughter of Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) Kinaki OGIMACHI.
sen.cmt: legitimateを追加しました。役職の頭文字を大文字に訂正しました。
sen.e: His legitimate wife was a daughter of Mitsuteru OTANI; His second wife was a daughter of Dainagon (Chief Councilor of State) Kinaki OGIMACHI.

sen.j: 実子に近衛府西園寺治季、養子縁組に近衛府西園寺公潔（有栖川宮韶仁親王の王子）がいる。
sen.e: His biological son was Konoefu (a government official at the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards), Harusue SAIONJI, and he adopted Konoefu, Kinzumi SAIONJI (son of Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Tsunahito).

He had several children including a biological son, Harusue SAIONJI who was Konoefu (Government Official at the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) and an adopted child, Kinzumi SAIONJI who was a biological son of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Tsunahito.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス及び単語整理のため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: He had several children including a biological son, Harusue SAIONJI who was Konoefu (Government Official at the Headquarters of the Inner Palace Guards) and an adopted child, Kinzumi SAIONJI who was a biological son of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Tsunahito.

sen.j: 二条治孝の三男として生まれたが、西園寺賞季の男子たちが相次いで早世し、相続人がいなくなっていたため、この寛季が西園寺家に養子に入って相続することとなった。
sen.e: He was born as the third son of Harutaka NIJO, but Yoshisue SAIONJI lost his sons early one after another and had no heir left, so Hirosue was adopted and became an heir.

Hirosue was born the third son of Harutaka NIJO; The lord Yoshisue SAIONJI adopted him from the Nijo family, because the lord's sons successively died at an early age; Consequently Hirosue became heir to the Saionji family.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス及び単語整理のため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: Hirosue was born the third son of Harutaka NIJO; The lord Yoshisue SAIONJI adopted him from the Nijo family, because the lord's sons successively died at an early age; Consequently Hirosue became heir to the Saionji family.

sen.j: 寛政6年（1794年）に叙爵し、以降清華家当主として速いスピードで累進し、寛政10年（1798年）には従三位となり、公卿に列した。
sen.e: In 1794, he was conferred a peerage and he got promoted quickly as the head of the Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families in Japan at that time), and in 1798, he became jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and he was raised to the court noble.

In 1794, he was conferred a peerage; Since then, as the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble in Japan at that time), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1798, he achieved to become Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス及び単語整理のため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: In 1794, he was conferred a peerage; Since then, as the head of the Seiga family (the second highest family status for the court noble in Japan at that time), he was successfully promoted in the Imperial Court in a short period; In 1798, he achieved to become Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), which gave him the title Kugyo.

sen.j: 文化 (元号)3年（1806年）から文化9年（1812年）にかけてと文政3年（1820年）から天保3年（1832年）の二度にかけて中納言を務めたが、何を思ったか天保3年（1832年）に46歳にして出家すると以降は朝廷に出仕しなくなった。
sen.e: He served as Chunagon (vice councilor of state) twice from 1806 to 1812 and from 1820 to 1832, but in 1832, he became a priest out of the blue at the age of 46, and stopped attending at the court.

He served as Chunagon (Vice Councilor of State) twice, in the periods: between 1806 and 1812: between 1820 and 1832; However, in 1832 when he was 46, he suddenly became a priest for some reasons; Since then, he no longer attended the court.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス及び単語整理のため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: He served as Chunagon (Vice Councilor of State) twice, in the periods: between 1806 and 1812: between 1820 and 1832; However, in 1832 when he was 46, he suddenly became a priest for some reasons; Since then, he no longer attended the court.

sen.j: 唯一の子である西園寺治季は、父に先立って文政9年（1826年）に薨去している。
sen.e: His only son, Harusue SAIONJI demised before his father in 1826.
His only son, Harusue SAIONJI passed away in 1826 before he died.
His only son, Harusue SAIONJI passed away in 1826 before he died.

sen.j: 治季の死後、治季の子西園寺師季が誕生しているが、生後直後であるので、有栖川宮韶仁親王の王子を養子とし、西園寺公潔として西園寺家を相続させた。
sen.e: After the death of Harusue, Morosue SAIONJI, Harusue's son was born, but since he had just been born, a son of Arisugawanomiya Imperial Prince Tsunahito was adopted and he succeeded the Saionji family as Kinzumi SAIONJI.

Just after Harusue SAIONJI died, his son, Morosue was born; However, because the baby was too small to become heir, the SAIONJI family adopted a son of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Tsunahito; The adopted son, who was named Kinzumi SAIONJI, succeeded the Saionji family.
sen.cmt: 文法ミス及び単語整理のため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: Just after Harusue SAIONJI died, his son, Morosue was born; However, because the baby was too small to become heir, the SAIONJI family adopted a son of Imperial Prince Arisugawanomiya Tsunahito; The adopted son, who was named Kinzumi SAIONJI, succeeded the Saionji family.

sen.j: なお、治季の実子の師季は、公潔が天保7年（1836年）に19歳にして薨去したために、その後を受けて西園寺家を相続している。
sen.e: Harusue's biological son, Morosue succeeded the Saionji family after Kinzumi's demise at the age of 19 in 1836.
Later, Harusue's biological son, Morosue became heir to the Saionji family after Kinzumi passed away at the age of 19 in 1836.
sen.cmt: Laterを追加しました。succeeded→became heir to, demise→passe awayに訂正しました。
sen.e: Later, Harusue's biological son, Morosue became heir to the Saionji family after Kinzumi passed away at the age of 19 in 1836.
